changed_version:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -1,20 +1,16 @@
-'''The Directorate''', or '''Directory''' (Директория, ''Dyrektoriya''), was a government of the [[Ukrainian National Republic]] formed in 1918 in rebellion against [[Skoropadsky]]'s [[Hetmanate]].
-With the defeat of the Central Powers in the First world war, Skoropadsky could no longer rely on Germany and Austria-Hungary's support. 
-In November 1918, Skoropadky's opponents set up a rival body known as the Directory, whose forces were headed by the newly reformed [[Sich Rifles]]. Most of Skoropadsky's troops joined with the Directory. Skoropadsky turned to many White Russian officers on their way to fight alongside Denikin, he formed them into a Special Corps, but these troops could not face the Directory troops.
-In December 1918, the Directory troops took Kiev and overthrew Skoropadsky's regime.
+'''The Directorate''', or '''Directory''' ({{lang-uk|Директорія}}, ''Dyrektoriya'') was a government of the [[Ukrainian National Republic]] formed in 1918 in rebellion against [[Skoropadsky]]'s [[Hetmanate]].
 
-The Directory re-established the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]], the UNR. The new regime was torn between the Ukrainian Nationalists and the Russian Federalists, and the Nationalists won, and the Directory began to be dominated by the Ukrainian Nationalist leader, [[Semen Petlura]].
+==History==
+With the defeat of the [[Central Powers]] in the [[First world war]], Skoropadsky could no longer rely on [[Germany]] and [[Austria-Hungary]]'s support. In [[November]] [[1918]], Skoropadky's opponents set up a rival body known as the Directory, whose forces were headed by the newly reformed [[Sich Rifles]]. Most of Skoropadsky's troops joined with the Directory. Skoropadsky turned to many White Russian officers on their way to fight alongside [[Denikin]], he formed them into a Special Corps, but these troops could not face the Directory troops. In [[December]] [[1918]], the Directory troops took [[Kiev]] and overthrew Skoropadsky's regime.
 
-Faced by many enemies on all sides the UNR's army was organised to face each threat. To the North-east were the Bolsheviks, to the south-east were the Russian Whites, to the south-west Rumanians who had claims on territory there, and the French Interventionists took [[Odessa]] in December 1918 to fill the power vacuum left by the widthdrawing Austrians and Germans.
-Coming quickly to terms with the French and the Rumanians, the UNR's army was able to employ more men on other fronts. 
-With major fighting breaking out in January 1919, the Ukrainians were pushed back and Kiev fell in February 1919. By May, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land  around [[Brody]]. They then negotiated with the Poles, who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamanets Podil'skyi]].
-In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the Western Ukrainian Republic's forces, who had been pushed out of Galicia by the Poles. 
-In May 1919, General Denikin and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during Summer and Sutumn, Denikin opushed the Reds out of Central and Eastern Ukraine, the Directory took this advnatge to re-take Kiev.
-But for all this, Red counter attacks and a deadly ty[phus epidemic caused the Ukrainian's to be pushed out of Ukrainian territory completely into Polish lands.
+The Directory re-established the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]] (UNR). The new regime was torn between the Ukrainian Nationalists and the Russian Federalists, and the Nationalists won, and the Directory began to be dominated by the Ukrainian Nationalist leader, [[Semen Petlura]].
 
-In 1920, the Poles helped form two new Ukrainian divisions and joined with each other after the defeat of Denikin. A UNR-Polish Treaty in April 1920 provided for combined operations between the two armies under overall Polish command. In the Soviet-Polish war of 1920, the Poles and Ukrainians advanced side by side, and the UNR was set up again when they re-took Kiev. 
-But a Summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disapointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polihs territory, however this was quickly beaten.
-They were forced back into Galicia, which became part of Polish territory in the [[Treaty of Riga]].
+Faced by many enemies on all sides the UNR's army was organised to face each threat. To the North-east were the [[Bolsheviks]], to the south-east were the [[White movement|Russian Whites]], to the south-west [[Rumanians]] who had claims on territory there, and the [[French]] Interventionists took [[Odessa]] in December 1918 to fill the power vacuum left by the withdrawing Austrians and Germans.
+Coming quickly to terms with the French and the Rumanians, the UNR's army was able to employ more men on other fronts.
+
+With major fighting breaking out in [[January]] [[1919]], the Ukrainians were pushed back and Kiev fell in [[February]] [[1919]]. By May, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land around [[Brody]]. They then negotiated with the [[Poles]], who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamianets-Podilskyi]]. In [[June]], the UNR's forces were joined by the [[Western Ukrainian Republic]]'s forces, who had been pushed out of [[Galicia]] by the Poles.  In [[May]] [[1919]], General Denikin and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during Summer and Autumn, Denikin pushed the Reds out of Central and Eastern Ukraine, the Directory took this advantage to re-take Kiev. But for all this, Red counter attacks and a deadly typhus epidemic caused the Ukrainian's to be pushed out of Ukrainian territory completely into Polish lands.
+
+In [[1920]], the Poles helped form two new Ukrainian divisions and joined with each other after the defeat of Denikin. A UNR-Polish Treaty in [[April]] [[1920]] provided for combined operations between the two armies under overall Polish command. In the [[Polish-Soviet War in 1920|Soviet-Polish war of 1920]], the Poles and Ukrainians advanced side by side, and the UNR was set up again when they re-took Kiev. But a Summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disappointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polish territory, however this was quickly beaten. They were forced back into Galicia, which became part of Polish territory in the [[Treaty of Riga]].
 
 {{Ukraine-hist-stub}}
llm_output:
Removed some text and added new sections with restructured content.

Not Weaponised. The changes made are primarily structural and do not introduce any weaponised narratives or terms related to cultural heritage. The focus remains on historical events without any charged language.

@@ -1,4 +1,20 @@
 '''The Directorate''', or '''Directory''' (Директория, ''Dyrektoriya''), was a government of the [[Ukrainian National Republic]] formed in 1918 in rebellion against [[Skoropadsky]]'s [[Hetmanate]].
+With the defeat of the Central Powers in the First world war, Skoropadsky could no longer rely on Germany and Austria-Hungary's support. 
+In November 1918, Skoropadky's opponents set up a rival body known as the Directory, whose forces were headed by the newly reformed [[Sich Rifles]]. Most of Skoropadsky's troops joined with the Directory. Skoropadsky turned to many White Russian officers on their way to fight alongside Denikin, he formed them into a Special Corps, but these troops could not face the Directory troops.
+In December 1918, the Directory troops took Kiev and overthrew Skoropadsky's regime.
+
+The Directory re-established the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]], the UNR. The new regime was torn between the Ukrainian Nationalists and the Russian Federalists, and the Nationalists won, and the Directory began to be dominated by the Ukrainian Nationalist leader, [[Semen Petlura]].
+
+Faced by many enemies on all sides the UNR's army was organised to face each threat. To the North-east were the Bolsheviks, to the south-east were the Russian Whites, to the south-west Rumanians who had claims on territory there, and the French Interventionists took [[Odessa]] in December 1918 to fill the power vacuum left by the widthdrawing Austrians and Germans.
+Coming quickly to terms with the French and the Rumanians, the UNR's army was able to employ more men on other fronts. 
+With major fighting breaking out in January 1919, the Ukrainians were pushed back and Kiev fell in February 1919. By May, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land  around [[Brody]]. They then negotiated with the Poles, who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamanets Podil'skyi]].
+In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the Western Ukrainian Republic's forces, who had been pushed out of Galicia by the Poles. 
+In May 1919, General Denikin and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during Summer and Sutumn, Denikin opushed the Reds out of Central and Eastern Ukraine, the Directory took this advnatge to re-take Kiev.
+But for all this, Red counter attacks and a deadly ty[phus epidemic caused the Ukrainian's to be pushed out of Ukrainian territory completely into Polish lands.
+
+In 1920, the Poles helped form two new Ukrainian divisions and joined with each other after the defeat of Denikin. A UNR-Polish Treaty in April 1920 provided for combined operations between the two armies under overall Polish command. In the Soviet-Polish war of 1920, the Poles and Ukrainians advanced side by side, and the UNR was set up again when they re-took Kiev. 
+But a Summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disapointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polihs territory, however this was quickly beaten.
+They were forced back into Galicia, which became part of Polish territory in the [[Treaty of Riga]].

In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the [[Western Ukrainian Republic]]'s forces, who had been pushed out of [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]] by the Poles.  In May 1919, General Denikin and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during Summer and Autumn, Denikin pushed the Reds out of Central and Eastern Ukraine, the Directory took this advantage to re-take Kiev. But for all this, Red counter attacks and a deadly typhus epidemic caused the Ukrainian's to be pushed out of Ukrainian territory completely into Polish lands.
 
 In 1920, the Poles helped form two new Ukrainian divisions and joined with each other after the defeat of Denikin. A UNR-Polish Treaty in April 1920 provided for combined operations between the two armies under overall Polish command. In the [[Polish-Soviet War in 1920|Soviet-Polish war of 1920]], the Poles and Ukrainians advanced side by side, and the UNR was set up again when they re-took Kiev. But a Summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disappointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polish territory, however this was quickly beaten. They were forced back into Galicia, which became part of Polish territory in the [[Treaty of Riga]].

changed_version:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@
 ==History==
 With the defeat of the [[Central Powers]] in the [[First world war]], Skoropadsky could no longer rely on [[Germany]] and [[Austria-Hungary]]'s support. In November 1918, Skoropadky's opponents set up a rival body known as the Directory, whose forces were headed by the newly reformed [[Sich Rifles]]. Most of Skoropadsky's troops joined with the Directory. Skoropadsky turned to many White Russian officers on their way to fight alongside [[Denikin]], forming them into a Special Corps, but these troops could not face the Directory troops. In December 1918, the Directory troops took [[Kiev]] and overthrew Skoropadsky's regime.
 
-The Directory re-established the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]] (UNR). The new regime was torn between the Ukrainian Nationalists and the Russian Federalists, and the Nationalists won, and the Directory began to be dominated by the Ukrainian Nationalist leader, [[Semen Petlura]].
+The Directory re-established the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]] (UNR). The new regime was torn between the Ukrainian Nationalists and the Russian Federalists, and the Nationalists won, and the Directory began to be dominated by the Ukrainian Nationalist leader, [[Symon Petliura]].
 
 Faced by many enemies on all sides the UNR's army was organised to face each threat. To the North-east were the [[Bolsheviks]], to the south-east were the [[White movement|Russian Whites]], to the south-west [[Rumanians]] who had claims on territory there, and the [[France|French]] intervention force took [[Odessa]] in December 1918 to fill the power vacuum left by the withdrawing Austrians and Germans.
 Coming quickly to terms with the French and the Rumanians, the UNR's army was able to employ more men on other fronts.

@@ -6,10 +6,10 @@
 
 The Directory re-established the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]] (UNR). The new regime was torn between the Ukrainian Nationalists and the Russian Federalists, and the Nationalists won, and the Directory began to be dominated by the Ukrainian Nationalist leader, [[Symon Petliura]].
 
-Faced by many enemies on all sides the UNR's army was organised to face each threat. To the North-east were the [[Bolsheviks]], to the south-east were the [[White movement|Russian Whites]], to the south-west [[Rumanians]] who had claims on territory there, and the [[France|French]] intervention force took [[Odessa]] in December 1918 to fill the power vacuum left by the withdrawing Austrians and Germans.
-Coming quickly to terms with the French and the Rumanians, the UNR's army was able to employ more men on other fronts.
+Faced by many enemies on all sides the UNR's army was organised to face each threat. To the North-east were the [[Bolsheviks]], to the south-east were the [[White movement|Russian Whites]], to the south-west [[Romania]]ns who had claims on territory there, and the [[France|French]] intervention force took [[Odessa]] in December 1918 to fill the power vacuum left by the withdrawing Austrians and Germans.
+Coming quickly to terms with the French and the Romanians, the UNR's army was able to employ more men on other fronts.
 
-With major fighting breaking out in January 1919, the Ukrainians were pushed back and Kiev fell in February 1919. By May, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land around [[Brody]]. They then negotiated with the [[Poles]], who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamianets-Podilskyi]]. In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the [[Western Ukrainian Republic]]'s forces, who had been pushed out of [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]] by the Poles.  In May 1919, General Denikin and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during Summer and Autumn, Denikin pushed the Reds out of Central and Eastern Ukraine, the Directory took this advantage to re-take Kiev. But for all this, Red counter attacks and a deadly typhus epidemic caused the Ukrainian's to be pushed out of Ukrainian territory completely into Polish lands.
+With major fighting breaking out in January 1919, the Ukrainians were pushed back and Kiev fell in February 1919. By May, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land around [[Brody]]. They then negotiated with the [[Poles]], who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamianets-Podilskyi]]. In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the [[Western Ukrainian Republic]]'s forces, who had been pushed out of [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]] by the Poles.  In May 1919, General Denikin and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during Summer and Autumn, Denikin pushed the Reds out of Central and Eastern Ukraine, the Directory took this advantage to re-take Kiev. But for all this, Red counter attacks and a deadly typhus epidemic caused the Ukrainians to be pushed out of Ukrainian territory completely into Polish lands.
 
 In 1920, the Poles helped form two new Ukrainian divisions and joined with each other after the defeat of Denikin. A UNR-Polish Treaty in April 1920 provided for combined operations between the two armies under overall Polish command. In the [[Polish-Soviet War in 1920|Soviet-Polish war of 1920]], the Poles and Ukrainians advanced side by side, and the UNR was set up again when they re-took Kiev. But a Summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disappointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polish territory, however this was quickly beaten. They were forced back into Galicia, which became part of Polish territory in the [[Treaty of Riga]].

 [[Image:Rząd URL 1920.jpg|300px|right|thumb|The Government of [[Ukrainian People's Republic|UNR]] [[1920]] - [[Symon Petliura|Symon Petlura]] sitting in the centre.]]'''The Directorate''', or '''Directory''' ({{lang-uk|Директорія}}, ''Dyrektoriya'') was a government of the [[Ukrainian National Republic]] formed in 1918 in rebellion against [[Skoropadsky]]'s [[Hetmanate]].
 
 ==History==
-With the defeat of the [[Central Powers]] in the [[First world war]], Skoropadsky could no longer rely on [[Germany]] and [[Austria-Hungary]]'s support. In November 1918, Skoropadky's opponents set up a rival body known as the Directory, whose forces were headed by the newly reformed [[Sich Rifles]]. Most of Skoropadsky's troops joined with the Directory. Skoropadsky turned to many White Russian officers on their way to fight alongside [[Denikin]], forming them into a Special Corps, but these troops could not face the Directory troops. In December 1918, the Directory troops took [[Kiev]] and overthrew Skoropadsky's regime.
+With the defeat of the [[Central Powers]] in [[World War I]], Skoropadsky could no longer rely on [[Germany]] and [[Austria-Hungary]]'s support. Most of Skoropadsky's troops joined with the Directory. Skoropadsky turned to many White Russian officers on their way to fight alongside [[Denikin]], forming them into a Special Corps, but these troops could not face the Directory troops. In December 1918, the Directory troops took [[Kiev]] and overthrew Skoropadsky's regime.
 
 The Directory re-established the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]] (UNR). The new regime was torn between the Ukrainian Nationalists and the Russian Federalists, and the Nationalists won, and the Directory began to be dominated by the Ukrainian Nationalist leader, [[Symon Petliura]].

It was decided not to restore functioning of the [[Central Rada]] which was favored by the SR-centrist [[Mykhailo Hrushevsky]] and [[Vsevolod Holubovych]].
 
 ==History==
 With the defeat of the [[Central Powers]] in [[World War I]], Skoropadsky could no longer rely on [[Germany]] and [[Austria-Hungary]]'s support. In November 1918, Skoropadky's opponents set up a rival body known as the Directory, whose forces were headed by the newly reformed [[Sich Rifles]]. Most of Skoropadsky's troops joined with the Directory. Skoropadsky turned to many White Russian officers on their way to fight alongside [[Denikin]], forming them into a Special Corps, but these troops could not face the Directory troops. In December 1918, the Directory troops took [[Kiev]] and overthrew Skoropadsky's regime.

changed_version:

+++ 
@@ -14,7 +14,7 @@
 With major fighting breaking out in January 1919, the Ukrainians were pushed back and Kiev fell in February 1919. By May, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land around [[Brody]]. Soviets then negotiated with the [[Poles]], who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamianets-Podilskyi]]. In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the [[Western Ukrainian Republic]]'s forces, who had been pushed out of [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]] by the Poles.  In May 1919, General Denikin and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during Summer and Autumn, Denikin pushed the Reds out of Central and Eastern Ukraine, the Directory took this advantage to re-take Kiev. But for all this, Red counter attacks and a deadly typhus epidemic caused the Ukrainians to be pushed out of Ukrainian territory completely into Polish lands.
 
 ==Kyiv Offensive 1920==
-In 1920, the Poles helped form two new Ukrainian divisions and joined with each other after the defeat of Denikin. A [[Warsaw Treaty (1920)|UNR-Polish Treaty]] in April 1920 provided for combined operations between the two armies under overall Polish command. In the [[Polish-Soviet War in 1920|Soviet-Polish war of 1920]], the Poles and Ukrainians advanced side by side, and the UNR was set up again when they re-took Kiev. But a Summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disappointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polish territory, however this was quickly beaten. They were forced back into Galicia, which became part of Polish territory in the [[Treaty of Riga]].
+In 1920, the Poles helped form two new Ukrainian divisions and joined with each other after the defeat of Denikin. But a Summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disappointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polish territory, however this was quickly beaten. They were forced back into Galicia, which became part of Polish territory in the [[Treaty of Riga]].

changed_version:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -10,6 +10,7 @@
 Faced by many enemies on all sides the UNR's army was organised to face each threat. To the North-east were the [[Bolsheviks]], to the south-east were the [[White movement|Russian Whites]], to the south-west [[Romania]]ns who had claims on territory there, and the [[France|French]] intervention force took [[Odessa]] in December 1918 to fill the power vacuum left by the withdrawing Austrians and Germans.
 Coming quickly to terms with the French and the Romanians, the UNR's army was able to employ more men on other fronts.
 
+==Soviet advance of 1919==
 With major fighting breaking out in January 1919, the Ukrainians were pushed back and Kiev fell in February 1919. By May, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land around [[Brody]]. They then negotiated with the [[Poles]], who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamianets-Podilskyi]]. In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the [[Western Ukrainian Republic]]'s forces, who had been pushed out of [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]] by the Poles.  In May 1919, General Denikin and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during Summer and Autumn, Denikin pushed the Reds out of Central and Eastern Ukraine, the Directory took this advantage to re-take Kiev. But for all this, Red counter attacks and a deadly typhus epidemic caused the Ukrainians to be pushed out of Ukrainian territory completely into Polish lands.
 
 In 1920, the Poles helped form two new Ukrainian divisions and joined with each other after the defeat of Denikin. A UNR-Polish Treaty in April 1920 provided for combined operations between the two armies under overall Polish command. In the [[Polish-Soviet War in 1920|Soviet-Polish war of 1920]], the Poles and Ukrainians advanced side by side, and the UNR was set up again when they re-took Kiev. But a Summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disappointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polish territory, however this was quickly beaten. They were forced back into Galicia, which became part of Polish territory in the [[Treaty of Riga]].

 {{History of Ukraine}}
-[[Image:Rząd URL 1920.jpg|300px|right|thumb|The Government of [[Ukrainian People's Republic|UNR]] [[1920]] - [[Symon Petliura|Symon Petlura]] sitting in the centre.]]'''The Directorate''', or '''Directory''' ({{lang-uk|Директорія}}, ''Dyrektoriya'') was a provisional government of the [[Ukrainian National Republic]] formed in 1918 in rebellion against [[Skoropadsky]]'s [[Hetmanate]]. The Directory was formed until the new council was to be elected to form the professional government. It was decided not to restore functioning of the [[Central Rada]] which was favored by the SR-centrist [[Mykhailo Hrushevsky]] and [[Vsevolod Holubovych]].
+[[Image:Rząd URL 1920.jpg|300px|right|thumb|The Government of [[Ukrainian People's Republic|UNR]] [[1920]] - [[Symon Petliura|Symon Petlura]] sitting in the centre.]]'''The Directorate''', or '''Directory''' ({{lang-uk|Директорія}}, ''Dyrektoriya'') was a provisional government of the [[Ukrainian National Republic]] formed in 1918 in rebellion against [[Skoropadsky]]'s [[Hetmanate]]. The Directory was formed until the new council was to be elected to form the professional government. It was decided not to restore functioning of the [[Central Rada]] which was favored by the SR-centrists [[Mykhailo Hrushevsky]] and [[Vsevolod Holubovych]].
 
 ==History==
 With the defeat of the [[Central Powers]] in [[World War I]], Skoropadsky could no longer rely on [[Germany]] and [[Austria-Hungary]]'s support. In November 1918, Skoropadky's opponents set up a rival body known as the Directory, whose forces were headed by the newly reformed [[Sich Rifles]]. Most of Skoropadsky's troops joined with the Directory. Skoropadsky turned to many White Russian officers on their way to fight alongside [[Denikin]], forming them into a Special Corps, but these troops could not face the Directory troops. In December 1918, the Directory troops took [[Kiev]] and overthrew Skoropadsky's regime.

@@ -10,10 +10,9 @@
 Faced by many enemies on all sides the UNR's army was organised to face each threat. To the North-east were the [[Bolsheviks]], to the south-east were the [[White movement|Russian Whites]], to the south-west [[Romania]]ns who had claims on territory there, and the [[France|French]] intervention force took [[Odessa]] in December 1918 to fill the power vacuum left by the withdrawing Austrians and Germans.
 Coming quickly to terms with the French and the Romanians, the UNR's army was able to employ more men on other fronts.
 
-==Soviet advance of 1919==
+===Change of powers 1919-1920===
 With major fighting breaking out in January 1919, the Ukrainians were pushed back and Kiev fell in February 1919. By May, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land around [[Brody]]. Soviets then negotiated with the [[Poles]], who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamianets-Podilskyi]]. In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the [[Western Ukrainian Republic]]'s forces, who had been pushed out of [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]] by the Poles.  In May 1919, General Denikin and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during Summer and Autumn, Denikin pushed the Reds out of Central and Eastern Ukraine, the Directory took this advantage to re-take Kiev. But for all this, Red counter attacks and a deadly typhus epidemic caused the Ukrainians to be pushed out of Ukrainian territory completely into Polish lands.
 
-==Kyiv Offensive 1920==
 In 1920, the Poles helped form two new Ukrainian divisions and joined with each other after the defeat of Denikin. A [[Treaty of Warsaw (1920)|UNR-Polish Treaty]] in April 1920 provided for combined operations between the two armies under overall Polish command. In the [[Polish-Soviet War in 1920|Soviet-Polish war of 1920]], the Poles and Ukrainians advanced side by side, and the UNR was set up again when they re-took Kiev. But a Summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disappointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polish territory, however this was quickly beaten. They were forced back into Galicia, which became part of Polish territory in the [[Treaty of Riga]].

In the [[Polish-Soviet War in 1920|Soviet-Polish war of 1920]], the Poles and Ukrainians advanced side by side, and the UNR was set up again when they re-took Kiev. But a Summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disappointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polish territory, however that was quickly beaten. They were forced back into Galicia. In 1920 Poland concluded a border dispute by the [[Treaty of Riga]] with the Soviet Union, thus, canceling the [[Treaty of Warsaw (1920)]].
 
 ==Members==
 *[[Volodymyr Vynnychenko]] (Chairman; November 14, 1918 - February 11, 1919)

+{{main|Ukrainian People's Republic}}
+'''The Directorate''', or '''Directory''' ({{Lang-uk|Директорія}}, ''Dyrektoriya'') was a provisional government of the [[Ukrainian National Republic]] formed in 1918 in rebellion against [[Skoropadsky]]'s [[Hetmanate]]. The Directory was formed until the new council was to be elected to form the professional government. It was decided not to restore functioning of the [[Central Rada]] which was favored by the SR-centrists [[Mykhailo Hrushevsky]] and [[Vsevolod Holubovych]].
 
 ==History==
 With the defeat of the [[Central Powers]] in [[World War I]], Skoropadsky could no longer rely on [[Germany]] and [[Austria-Hungary]]'s support. On November 13, 1918 Skoropadky's opponents set up a rival body known as the Directory, whose forces were headed by the newly reformed [[Sich Rifles]]. Most of Skoropadsky's troops joined with the Directory. Skoropadsky turned to many White Russian officers on their way to fight alongside [[Denikin]], forming them into a Special Corps, but these troops could not face the Directory troops. In December 1918, the Directory troops took [[Kiev]] and overthrew Skoropadsky's regime.

changed_version:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -5,9 +5,11 @@
 '''The Directorate''', or '''Directory''' ({{Lang-uk|Директорія}}, ''Dyrektoriya'') was a provisional government of the [[Ukrainian National Republic]] formed in 1918 in rebellion against [[Skoropadsky]]'s [[Hetmanate]]. The Directory was formed until the new council was to be elected to form the professional government. It was decided not to restore functioning of the [[Central Rada]] which was favored by the SR-centrists [[Mykhailo Hrushevsky]] and [[Vsevolod Holubovych]].
 
 ==History==
-With the defeat of the [[Central Powers]] in [[World War I]], Skoropadsky could no longer rely on [[Germany]] and [[Austria-Hungary]]'s support. On November 13, 1918 Skoropadky's opponents set up a rival body known as the Directory, whose forces were headed by the newly reformed [[Sich Rifles]]. Most of Skoropadsky's troops joined with the Directory. Skoropadsky turned to many White Russian officers on their way to fight alongside [[Denikin]], forming them into a Special Corps, but these troops could not face the Directory troops. In December 1918, the Directory troops took [[Kiev]] and overthrew Skoropadsky's regime.
+With the defeat of the [[Central Powers]] in [[World War I]], Skoropadsky could no longer rely on [[Germany]] and [[Austria-Hungary]]'s support. On November 13, 1918 Skoropadky's opponents set up a rival body known as the Directory, whose forces were headed by the newly reformed [[Sich Rifles]]. Most of Skoropadsky's troops joined with the Directory. Skoropadsky turned to many White Russian officers on their way to fight alongside [[Denikin]], forming them into a Special Corps, but these troops could not face the Directory troops. On December 19, 1918, the Directory troops took [[Kiev]] and overthrew Skoropadsky's regime.
 
-The Directory re-established the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]] (UNR). The new regime was torn between the Ukrainian Nationalists and the Russian Federalists, and the Nationalists won, and the Directory began to be dominated by the Ukrainian Nationalist leader, [[Symon Petliura]].
+The Directory re-established the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]] (UNR). The new regime was torn between the pro-nationalistic, including the party of peasant-democrats, and the factions for the federal union with Russia. At the end the idea to reestablish the [[Central Rada]] was set aside as well as to recover all its legal acts. On December 26, 1918 the Directory released its declaration to eliminate the Hetman regime.
+
+By the end of 1918 the Directory began to be dominated by the Ukrainian military leader, [[Symon Petliura]]. 
 
 Faced by many enemies on all sides the UNR's army was organised to face each threat. To the North-east were the [[Bolsheviks]], to the south-east were the [[White movement|Russian Whites]], to the south-west [[Romania]]ns who had claims on territory there, and the [[France|French]] intervention force took [[Odessa]] in December 1918 to fill the power vacuum left by the withdrawing Austrians and Germans.
 Coming quickly to terms with the French and the Romanians, the UNR's army was able to employ more men on other fronts.
@@ -16,6 +18,13 @@
 With major fighting breaking out in January 1919, the Ukrainians were pushed back and Kiev fell in February 1919. That was followed by a political crisis inside the Directory with [[Volodymyr Vynnychenko]] resignation due to failure of reaching a consensus with [[Symon Petliura]]. Most of other members of the Directory were either fired or requested their resignation making [[Symon Petliura]] the sole head of state by 1920. By May of 1919, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land around [[Brody]]. Soviets then negotiated with the [[Poles]], who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamianets-Podilskyi]]. In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the [[Western Ukrainian Republic]]'s forces, who had been pushed out of [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]] by the Poles.  During that time (May of 1919), General [[Anton Denikin|Denikin]] and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during the summer and autumn of that year. The ''White Guards'' forces pushed the Reds out of the Central and Eastern Ukraine, thus, given the Directory another chance to reclaim [[Kyiv]]. But the constant ''Red Guards'' counter-attacks and a deadly typhus epidemic caused the Petliura forces to be pushed out of Ukraine completely into the well established territory of Poland.
 
 In 1920, the Polish Army reorganized with the help from the two new Ukrainian divisions to prepare an offensive against the Denikin's forces. A [[Treaty of Warsaw (1920)|UNR-Polish Treaty]] in April 1920 provided for combined operations between the two armies under overall Polish command while recognizing the Polish sovereignty over the territory of the former [[West Ukrainian People's Republic]] with the border passing along the [[Zbruch river]]. In the [[Polish-Soviet War in 1920|Soviet-Polish war of 1920]], the Poles and Ukrainians advanced side by side, and the UNR was set up again when they re-took Kiev. But less than a month later the Soviet's summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disappointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polish territory, however that was quickly beaten. They were forced back into Galicia. In 1920 Poland concluded a border dispute by the [[Treaty of Riga]] with the Soviet Union, thus, canceling the [[Treaty of Warsaw (1920)]].
+
+==Normative Acts==
+At the first stage the Directory recovered all of the rights of peasants and workers that was established by the laws passed by the [[Central Rada]].
+
+''Until the complete solution of the Land Reform, the Directory of the Ukrainian People's Republic declares that all small peasant's holdings and all worker's holdings to be left for use of their previous owners, while the rest of lands to be transferred to the peasant with little or no land holdings with the priorities to those joined the Republican forces against the struggle with the former [[Pavlo Skoropadsky|Hetman]]. The Supreme subordination over the land carries the Directory of the Ukrainian People's Republic. This statement concerns also the monastery, church, and government land holdings. For introduction of the Reform there was organized the People's Land Committee...''
+
+The Directory canceled all the codes of the former Hetmanate government concerning workers policies. The eight-hour working day was reestablished as well as the practice of cooperative agreements, the rights on coalition and activist strikes, and others.
 
 ==Members==
 *[[Volodymyr Vynnychenko]] (Chairman; November 14, 1918 - February 11, 1919)
llm_output:

 ===Change of powers 1919-1920===
-With major fighting breaking out in January 1919, the Ukrainians were pushed back and Kiev fell in February 1919. By May, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land around [[Brody]]. Soviets then negotiated with the [[Poles]], who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamianets-Podilskyi]]. In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the [[Western Ukrainian Republic]]'s forces, who had been pushed out of [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]] by the Poles.  In May 1919, General Denikin and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during Summer and Autumn, Denikin pushed the Reds out of Central and Eastern Ukraine, the Directory took this advantage to re-take Kiev. But for all this, Red counter attacks and a deadly typhus epidemic caused the Ukrainians to be pushed out of Ukrainian territory completely into Polish lands.
+With major fighting breaking out in January 1919, the Ukrainians were pushed back and Kiev fell in February 1919. That was followed by a political crisis inside the Directory with [[Volodymyr Vynnychenko]] resignation due to failure of reaching a consensus with [[Symon Petliura]]. Most of other members of the Directory were either fired or requested their resignation making [[Symon Petliura]] the sole head of state by 1920. By May of 1919, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land around [[Brody]]. Soviets then negotiated with the [[Poles]], who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamianets-Podilskyi]]. In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the [[Western Ukrainian Republic]]'s forces, who had been pushed out of [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]] by the Poles.  During that time (May of 1919), General [[Anton Denikin|Denikin]] and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during the summer and autumn of that year. The ''White Guards'' forces pushed the Reds out of the Central and Eastern Ukraine, thus, given the Directory another chance to reclaim [[Kyiv]]. But the constant ''Red Guards'' counter-attacks and a deadly typhus epidemic caused the Petliura forces to be pushed out of Ukraine completely into the well established territory of Poland.
 
-In 1920, the Poles helped form two new Ukrainian divisions and joined with each other after the defeat of Denikin. A [[Treaty of Warsaw (1920)|UNR-Polish Treaty]] in April 1920 provided for combined operations between the two armies under overall Polish command while recognizing the Polish sovereignty over the territory of the former [[West Ukrainian People's Republic]] with the border passing along the [[Zbruch river]]. In the [[Polish-Soviet War in 1920|Soviet-Polish war of 1920]], the Poles and Ukrainians advanced side by side, and the UNR was set up again when they re-took Kiev. But less than a month later the Soviet's summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disappointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polish territory, however that was quickly beaten. They were forced back into Galicia. In 1920 Poland concluded a border dispute by the [[Treaty of Riga]] with the Soviet Union, thus, canceling the [[Treaty of Warsaw (1920)]].
+In 1920, the Polish Army reorganized with the help from the two new Ukrainian divisions to prepare an offensive against the Denikin's forces. A [[Treaty of Warsaw (1920)|UNR-Polish Treaty]] in April 1920 provided for combined operations between the two armies under overall Polish command while recognizing the Polish sovereignty over the territory of the former [[West Ukrainian People's Republic]] with the border passing along the [[Zbruch river]]. In the [[Polish-Soviet War in 1920|Soviet-Polish war of 1920]], the Poles and Ukrainians advanced side by side, and the UNR was set up again when they re-took Kiev. But less than a month later the Soviet's summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disappointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polish territory, however that was quickly beaten. They were forced back into Galicia. In 1920 Poland concluded a border dispute by the [[Treaty of Riga]] with the Soviet Union, thus, canceling the [[Treaty of Warsaw (1920)]].
 
 ==Members==
 *[[Volodymyr Vynnychenko]] (Chairman; November 14, 1918 - February 11, 1919)

In light of that a new Prime-Minister was appointed as well, [[Serhiy Ostapenko]] who headed his non-socialist government on [[Febraury 11]], 1919. +'''The Directorate''', or '''Directory''' ({{Lang-uk|Директорія}}, ''Dyrektoriya'') was a provisional government of the [[Ukrainian National Republic]] formed in 1918 in rebellion against [[Skoropadsky]]'s [[Hetmanate]], the Executive Council of the State Affairs ({{Lang-uk|Рада Завідуючих Державними Справами}}). 
+
+==Overview==
+The Directory was formed until the new council was to be elected to form the professional government. It was decided not to restore functioning of the [[Central Rada]] which was favored by the SR-centrists [[Mykhailo Hrushevsky]] and [[Vsevolod Holubovych]]. The new council, the [[Labor Congress]], appointed the Directory as the Extraordinary Government Body in the protection of the republic. It was charged to enact the laws in the absense of the [[Labor Congress]] due to the political situation in the country, while the Council of the People's Ministers was invested with the executive powers.
 
 ==History==
 With the defeat of the [[Central Powers]] in [[World War I]], Skoropadsky could no longer rely on [[Germany]] and [[Austria-Hungary]]'s support. On November 13, 1918 Skoropadky's opponents set up a rival body known as the Directory, whose forces were headed by the newly reformed [[Sich Rifles]]. Most of Skoropadsky's troops joined with the Directory during a month long the Ukrainian Civil War. Skoropadsky then turned to some of the Russian officers who were fighting alongside [[Denikin]], forming them into a Special Corps, but these troops were not able to face the Directory troops. On December 19, 1918, the Directory troops took [[Kiev]] and overthrew Skoropadsky's regime.

changed_version:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -29,6 +29,7 @@
 Faced by many enemies on all sides the UNR's army was organised to face each threat. To the North-east were the [[Bolsheviks]], to the south-east were the [[White movement|Russian Whites]], to the south-west [[Romania]]ns who had claims on territory in [[Bucovina]] and [[Halychyna]], and the [[France|French]] intervention force took [[Odessa]] in December 1918 to fill the power vacuum left by the withdrawing Austrians and Germans. Coming quickly to some understanding with the French and the Romanians, the UNR's army was able to employ more men on other fronts.
 
 ===Change of powers 1919-1920===
+{{seealso|Ukrainian–Soviet War}}
 With major fighting breaking out in January 1919, the Ukrainians were pushed back and Kiev fell in February 1919. The government moved to [[Vinnytsia]] on [[February 5]], 1919. A political trick took place that the Directory tried to play with [[Volodymyr Vynnychenko]] resignation to demonstrate a change of powers in the Ukrainian government and maybe attain a possible acceptance with the Entante. [[Symon Petliura]] has left the party and replaced the Vynnychenko's position who was too well known. Petliura has assumed the position of the Directory's chairman on [[February 11]], 1919, a week after the government moved to [[Podolie|Podillia]]. The talks, alias, were proved to be without results. By May of 1919, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land around [[Brody]]. Soviets then negotiated with the [[Poles]], who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamianets-Podilskyi]]. In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the [[Western Ukrainian Republic]]'s forces, who had been pushed out of [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]] by the Poles.  During that time (May of 1919), General [[Anton Denikin|Denikin]] and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during the summer and autumn of that year. The ''White Guards'' forces pushed the Reds out of the Central and Eastern Ukraine, thus, given the Directory another chance to reclaim [[Kyiv]]. But the constant ''Red Guards'' counter-attacks and a deadly typhus epidemic caused the Petliura forces to be pushed out of Ukraine completely into the well established territory of Poland. A political crisis took place inside the Directory members of which were heavily interfered in the affairs of the Council of People's Ministers. Because of that Shvets and Makarenko were sent on the state matters abroad. Later in May of 1920 on the request of Petliura to return they did not reply and were dismissed.
 
 In 1920, the Polish Army reorganized with the help from the two new Ukrainian divisions to prepare an offensive against the Denikin's forces. A [[Treaty of Warsaw (1920)|UNR-Polish Treaty]] in April 1920 provided for combined operations between the two armies under overall Polish command while recognizing the Polish sovereignty over the territory of the former [[West Ukrainian People's Republic]] with the border passing along the [[Zbruch river]]. In the [[Polish-Soviet War in 1920|Soviet-Polish war of 1920]], the Poles and Ukrainians advanced side by side, and the UNR was set up again when they re-took Kiev. But less than a month later the Soviet's summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disappointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polish territory, however that was quickly beaten. They were forced back into Galicia. In 1920 Poland concluded a border dispute by the [[Treaty of Riga]] with the Soviet Union, thus, canceling the [[Treaty of Warsaw (1920)]].

A political trick took place that the Directory tried to play with [[Volodymyr Vynnychenko]] resignation to demonstrate a change of powers in the Ukrainian government and maybe attain a possible acceptance with the Entante. [[Symon Petliura]] has left the party and replaced the Vynnychenko's position who was too well known. Petliura has assumed the position of the Directory's chairman on [[February 11]], 1919, a week after the government moved to [[Podolie|Podillia]]. The talks, alias, were proved to be without results. By May of 1919, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land around [[Brody]]. Soviets then negotiated with the [[Poles]], who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamianets-Podilskyi]]. In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the [[Western Ukrainian Republic]]'s forces, who had been pushed out of [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]] by the Poles.  During that time (May of 1919), General [[Anton Denikin|Denikin]] and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during the summer and autumn of that year. The ''White Guards'' forces pushed the Reds out of the Central and Eastern Ukraine, thus, given the Directory another chance to reclaim [[Kyiv]]. But the constant ''Red Guards'' counter-attacks and a deadly typhus epidemic caused the Petliura forces to be pushed out of Ukraine completely into the well established territory of Poland. A political crisis took place inside the Directory members of which were heavily intervening with the Council of People's Ministers. Because of that Shvets and Makarenko were sent on the state matters abroad. Later in May of 1920 on the request of Petliura to return they did not reply and were dismissed.
 
 In 1920, the Polish Army reorganized with the help from the two new Ukrainian divisions to prepare an offensive against the Denikin's forces. In the [[Polish-Soviet War in 1920|Soviet-Polish war of 1920]], the Poles and Ukrainians advanced side by side, and the UNR was set up again when they re-took Kiev. But less than a month later the Soviet's summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disappointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polish territory, however that was quickly beaten. They were forced back into Galicia. In 1920 Poland concluded a border dispute by the [[Treaty of Riga]] with the Soviet Union, thus, canceling the [[Treaty of Warsaw (1920)]].

+With major fighting breaking out in January 1919, the Ukrainians were pushed back and Kiev fell in February 1919. The government moved to [[Vinnytsia]] on [[February 5]], 1919. A political trick took place that the Directory tried to play with [[Volodymyr Vynnychenko]] resignation to demonstrate a change of powers in the Ukrainian government and maybe attain a possible acceptance with the Entante. [[Symon Petliura]] has left the party and replaced the Vynnychenko's position who was too well known. Petliura has assumed the position of the Directory's chairman on [[February 11]], 1919, a week after the government moved to [[Podolie|Podillia]]. The talks, alias, were proved to be without results. By May of 1919, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land around [[Brody]]. Soviets then negotiated with the [[Poles]], who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamianets-Podilskyi]]. In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the [[Western Ukrainian Republic]]'s forces, who had been pushed out of [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]] by the Poles.  During that time (May of 1919), General [[Anton Denikin|Denikin]] and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during the summer and autumn of that year. The ''White Guards'' forces pushed the Reds out of the Central and Eastern Ukraine, thus, given the Directory another chance to reclaim [[Kyiv]]. But the constant ''Red Guards'' counter-attacks and a deadly typhus epidemic caused the Petliura forces to be pushed out of Ukraine completely into the well established territory of Poland. A political crisis took place inside the Directory members of which were heavily interfered in the affairs of the Council of People's Ministers. Because of that Shvets and Makarenko were sent on the state matters abroad. Later in May of 1920 on the request of Petliura to return they did not reply and were dismissed.
 
 In 1920, the Polish Army reorganized with the help from the two new Ukrainian divisions to prepare an offensive against the Denikin's forces. A [[Treaty of Warsaw (1920)|UNR-Polish Treaty]] in April 1920 provided for combined operations between the two armies under overall Polish command while recognizing the Polish sovereignty over the territory of the former [[West Ukrainian People's Republic]] with the border passing along the [[Zbruch river]]. In the [[Polish-Soviet War in 1920|Soviet-Polish war of 1920]], the Poles and Ukrainians advanced side by side, and the UNR was set up again when they re-took Kiev. But less than a month later the Soviet's summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disappointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polish territory, however that was quickly beaten. They were forced back into Galicia. In 1920 Poland concluded a border dispute by the [[Treaty of Riga]] with the Soviet Union, thus, canceling the [[Treaty of Warsaw (1920)]].

 ==History==
-==Post-Hetmanate recovery==
+===Post-Hetmanate recovery===
 With the defeat of the [[Central Powers]] in [[World War I]], Skoropadsky could no longer rely on [[Germany]] and [[Austria-Hungary]]'s support. On November 13, 1918 Skoropadky's opponents set up a rival body known as the Directory, whose forces were headed by the newly reformed [[Sich Rifles]]. Most of Skoropadsky's troops joined with the Directory during a month long the Ukrainian Civil War. Skoropadsky then turned to some of the Russian officers who were fighting alongside [[Denikin]], forming them into a Special Corps, but these troops were not able to face the Directory troops. On December 19, 1918, the Directory troops took [[Kiev]] and overthrew Skoropadsky's regime.
 
 The Directory re-established the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]] (UNR). The new regime was torn between the pro-nationalistic, including the party of peasant-democrats, and the factions for the federal union with Russia. At the end the idea to reestablish the [[Central Rada]] was set aside as well as to recover all its legal acts yet the most important one were preserved. On December 26, 1918 the Directory released its declaration to eliminate the Hetman regime.

changed_version:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -4,11 +4,11 @@
 
 '''The Directorate''', or '''Directory''' ({{Lang-uk|Директорія}}, ''Dyrektoriya'') was a provisional government of the [[Ukrainian National Republic]] formed in 1918 in rebellion against [[Skoropadsky]]'s [[Hetmanate]], the Executive Council of the State Affairs ({{Lang-uk|Рада Завідуючих Державними Справами}}) or a collective presidential cabinet. It dissolved on [[November 10]], 1920. On [[November 12]], 1920 by the 'Law on the Temporary Supreme Authority and the Legislative System of the UNR' the executive council was reformed into a single person government position.
 
-==Overview==
-The Directory was formed until the new council was to be elected to form the professional government. It was decided not to restore functioning of the [[Central Rada]] which was favored by the [[Ukrainian Socialist-Revolutionary Party|SR-centrists]] [[Mykhailo Hrushevsky]] and [[Vsevolod Holubovych]]. The new council, the [[Labor Congress]], appointed the Directory as the Extraordinary Government Body in the protection of the republic. It was charged to [[enact]] laws in the absense of the [[Labor Congress]] due to the political situation in the country, while the Council of the People's Ministers was invested with the executive powers.
+== Overview ==
+The Directory was formed until the new council was to be elected to form the professional government. It was decided not to restore functioning of the [[Central Rada]] which was favored by the [[Ukrainian Socialist-Revolutionary Party|SR-centrists]] [[Mykhailo Hrushevsky]] and [[Vsevolod Holubovych]].  The new council, the [[Labor Congress]], appointed the Directory as the Extraordinary Government Body in the protection of the republic. It was charged to [[enact]] laws in the absence of the [[Labor Congress]] due to the political situation in the country, while the Council of the People's Ministers was invested with the executive powers.
 
-==Members==
-Vynnychenko left the government in hope for the Directory to establish friendly talks with representatives of the Entante<ref>Other speculate that Vynnychenko left because of his political disagreement in the state affairs with Petliura.</ref> while Petliura left the SDPists, thus demonstrating that the Ukrainian government has changed its political agenda and is not the same that signed the treaty in [[Brest, Belarus|Brest-Litovsk]]. In light of that a new Prime-Minister was appointed as well, [[Serhiy Ostapenko]] who headed his non-socialist government on [[Febraury 11]], 1919. When the talks have failed Ostapenko was replaced by [[Borys Martos]] on [[April 9]], 1919.
+== Members ==
+Vynnychenko left the government in hope for the Directory to establish friendly talks with representatives of the Entante<ref>Other speculate that Vynnychenko left because of his political disagreement in the state affairs with Petliura.</ref> while Petliura left the SDPists, thus demonstrating that the Ukrainian government has changed its political agenda and is not the same that signed the treaty in [[Brest, Belarus|Brest-Litovsk]].  In light of that a new Prime-Minister was appointed as well, [[Serhiy Ostapenko]] who headed his non-socialist government on [[February 11]], 1919. When the talks have failed Ostapenko was replaced by [[Borys Martos]] on [[April 9]], 1919.

 '''The Directorate''', or '''Directory''' ({{Lang-uk|Директорія}}, ''Dyrektoriya'') was a provisional government of the [[Ukrainian National Republic]] formed in 1918 in rebellion against [[Skoropadsky]]'s [[Hetmanate]], the Executive Council of the State Affairs ({{Lang-uk|Рада Завідуючих Державними Справами}}) or a collective presidential cabinet. It dissolved on [[November 10]], 1920. On [[November 12]], 1920 by the 'Law on the Temporary Supreme Authority and the Legislative System of the UNR' the executive council was reformed into a single person government position.
 
 == Overview ==
-The Directory was formed until the new council was to be elected to form the professional government. It was decided not to restore functioning of the [[Central Rada]] which was favored by the [[Ukrainian Socialist-Revolutionary Party|SR-centrists]] [[Mykhailo Hrushevsky]] and [[Vsevolod Holubovych]].  The new council, the [[Labor Congress]], appointed the Directory as the Extraordinary Government Body in the protection of the republic. It was charged to [[enact]] laws in the absence of the [[Labor Congress]] due to the political situation in the country, while the Council of the People's Ministers was invested with the executive powers.
+The Directory was formed until a new council was to be elected to form the professional government. It was decided not to restore functioning of the [[Central Rada]] which was favored by the [[Ukrainian Socialist-Revolutionary Party|SR-centrists]] [[Mykhailo Hrushevsky]] and [[Vsevolod Holubovych]].  The new council, the [[Labor Congress]], appointed the Directory as the Extraordinary Government Body in the protection of the republic. It was charged to [[enact]] laws in the absence of the [[Labor Congress]] due to the political situation in the country, while the Council of the People's Ministers was invested with the executive powers.
 
 == Members ==
 Vynnychenko left the government in hope for the Directory to establish friendly talks with representatives of the Entante<ref>Other speculate that Vynnychenko left because of his political disagreement in the state affairs with Petliura.</ref> while Petliura left the SDPists, thus demonstrating that the Ukrainian government has changed its political agenda and is not the same that signed the treaty in [[Brest, Belarus|Brest-Litovsk]].  In light of that a new Prime-Minister was appointed as well, [[Serhiy Ostapenko]] who headed his non-socialist government on [[February 11]], 1919. When the talks have failed Ostapenko was replaced by [[Borys Martos]] on [[April 9]], 1919.

 #[[Volodymyr Vynnychenko]] ([[Ukrainian Social Democratic Labour Party|SDPists]], Chairman; November 14, 1918 - February 11, 1919)
 #[[Symon Petliura]] ([[Ukrainian Social Democratic Labour Party|SDPists]], delegate of the [[Sich Riflemen]]. Chairman, February 11, 1919 - November 10, 1920)
@@ -25,13 +25,13 @@
 
 The Directory re-established the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]] (UNR).  The new regime was torn between the pro-nationalistic, including the party of peasant-democrats, and the factions for the federal union with Russia. At the end the idea to reestablish the [[Central Rada]] was set aside as well as to recover all its legal acts yet the most important one were preserved. On December 26, 1918 the Directory released its declaration to eliminate the Hetman regime.
 
-By the end of 1918 the Directory began to be dominated by the Ukrainian military leader, [[Symon Petliura]]. 
+By the end of 1918 the Directory began to be dominated by the Ukrainian military leader, [[Symon Petliura]].
 
 Faced by many enemies on all sides the UNR's army was organised to face each threat. To the North-east were the [[Bolsheviks]], to the south-east were the [[White movement|Russian Whites]], to the south-west [[Romania]]ns who had claims on territory in [[Bucovina]] and [[Halychyna]], and the [[France|French]] intervention force took [[Odessa]] in December 1918 to fill the power vacuum left by the withdrawing Austrians and Germans. Coming quickly to some understanding with the French and the Romanians, the UNR's army was able to employ more men on other fronts.
 
 ===Change of powers 1919-1920===
 {{seealso|Ukrainian–Soviet War}}
-With major fighting breaking out in January 1919, the Ukrainians were pushed back and Kiev fell in February 1919. The government moved to [[Vinnytsia]] on [[February 5]], 1919. A political trick took place that the Directory tried to play with [[Volodymyr Vynnychenko]] resignation to demonstrate a change of powers in the Ukrainian government and maybe attain a possible acceptance with the Entante. [[Symon Petliura]] has left the party and replaced the Vynnychenko's position who was too well known. Petliura has assumed the position of the Directory's chairman on [[February 11]], 1919, a week after the government moved to [[Podolie|Podillia]]. The talks, alias, were proved to be without results. By May of 1919, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land around [[Brody]]. Soviets then negotiated with the [[Poles]], who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamianets-Podilskyi]]. In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the [[Western Ukrainian Republic]]'s forces, who had been pushed out of [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]] by the Poles.  During that time (May of 1919), General [[Anton Denikin|Denikin]] and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during the summer and autumn of that year. The ''White Guards'' forces pushed the Reds out of the Central and Eastern Ukraine, thus, given the Directory another chance to reclaim [[Kiev]]. But the constant ''Red Guards'' counter-attacks and a deadly typhus epidemic caused the Petliura forces to be pushed out of Ukraine completely into the well established territory of Poland. A political crisis took place inside the Directory members of which were heavily interfered in the affairs of the Council of People's Ministers. Because of that Shvets and Makarenko were sent on the state matters abroad. Later in May of 1920 on the request of Petliura to return they did not reply and were dismissed.
+With major fighting breaking out in January 1919, the Ukrainians were pushed back and Kiev fell in February 1919. The government moved to [[Vinnytsia]] on [[February 5]], 1919. A political trick took place that the Directory tried to play with [[Volodymyr Vynnychenko]] resignation to demonstrate a change of powers in the Ukrainian government and maybe attain a possible acceptance with the Entante. [[Symon Petliura]] has left the party and replaced the Vynnychenko's position who was too well known. Petliura has assumed the position of the Directory's chairman on [[February 11]], 1919, a week after the government moved to [[Podolie|Podillia]]. The talks, alias, were proved to be without results. By May 1919, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land around [[Brody]]. Soviets then negotiated with the [[Poles]], who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamianets-Podilskyi]]. In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the [[Western Ukrainian Republic]]'s forces, who had been pushed out of [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]] by the Poles.  During that time (May 1919), General [[Anton Denikin|Denikin]] and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during the summer and autumn of that year. The ''White Guards'' forces pushed the Reds out of the Central and Eastern Ukraine, thus, given the Directory another chance to reclaim [[Kiev]]. But the constant ''Red Guards'' counter-attacks and a deadly typhus epidemic caused the Petliura forces to be pushed out of Ukraine completely into the well established territory of Poland. A political crisis took place inside the Directory members of which were heavily interfered in the affairs of the Council of People's Ministers. Because of that Shvets and Makarenko were sent on the state matters abroad. Later in May 1920 on the request of Petliura to return they did not reply and were dismissed.
 
 In 1920, the Polish Army reorganized with the help from the two new Ukrainian divisions to prepare an offensive against the Denikin's forces. A [[Treaty of Warsaw (1920)|UNR-Polish Treaty]] in April 1920 provided for combined operations between the two armies under overall Polish command while recognizing the Polish sovereignty over the territory of the former [[West Ukrainian People's Republic]] with the border passing along the [[Zbruch river]]. In the [[Polish-Soviet War in 1920|Soviet-Polish war of 1920]], the Poles and Ukrainians advanced side by side, and the UNR was set up again when they re-took Kiev. But less than a month later the Soviet's summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disappointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polish territory, however that was quickly beaten. They were forced back into Galicia. In 1920 Poland concluded a border dispute by the [[Treaty of Riga]] with the Soviet Union, thus, canceling the [[Treaty of Warsaw (1920)]].

 {{History of Ukraine}}
 {{main|Ukrainian People's Republic}}
 
-'''The Directorate''', or '''Directory''' ({{Lang-uk|Директорія}}, ''Dyrektoriya'') was a provisional government of the [[Ukrainian National Republic]] formed in 1918 in rebellion against [[Skoropadsky]]'s [[Hetmanate]], the Executive Council of the State Affairs ({{Lang-uk|Рада Завідуючих Державними Справами}}) or a collective presidential cabinet. It dissolved on [[November 10]], 1920. +'''The Directorate''', or '''Directory''' ({{Lang-uk|Директорія}}, ''Dyrektoriya'') was a provisional revolutionary state committee of the [[Ukrainian National Republic]] formed in 1918 by the [[Ukrainian National Union]] in rebellion against [[Ukrainian State|Skoropadsky's regime]]. During the overthrow of Pavlo Skoropadsky was named as the Executive Council of the State Affairs ({{Lang-uk|Рада Завідуючих Державними Справами}}). It dissolved on [[November 10]], 1920. On [[November 12]], 1920 by the 'Law on the Temporary Supreme Authority and the Legislative System of the UNR' the executive council was reformed into a single person government position.
 
 ==Overview==
-The Directory was formed until a new council was to be elected to form the professional government. It was decided not to restore functioning of the [[Central Rada]] which was favored by the [[Ukrainian Socialist-Revolutionary Party|SR-centrists]] [[Mykhailo Hrushevsky]] and [[Vsevolod Holubovych]].  The new council, the [[Labor Congress]], appointed the Directory as the Extraordinary Government Body in the protection of the republic. It was charged to [[enact]] laws in the absence of the [[Labor Congress]] due to the political situation in the country, while the Council of the People's Ministers was invested with the executive powers.
+The Directory was formed until a new council was to be elected to form the professional government. It was decided not to restore functioning of the [[Central Rada]] which was favored by the [[Ukrainian Socialist-Revolutionary Party|SR-centrists]] [[Mykhailo Hrushevsky]] and [[Vsevolod Holubovych]]. The new council, the [[Labor Congress]], appointed the Directory as the Extraordinary Government Body in the protection of the republic. It was charged to [[enact]] laws in the absence of the [[Labor Congress]] due to the political situation in the country, while the Council of the People's Ministers was invested with the executive powers. The Directory consisted of five delegates from various parties and representation groups.
 
 ==Members==
 Vynnychenko left the government in hope for the Directory to establish friendly talks with representatives of the Entante<ref>Other speculate that Vynnychenko left because of his political disagreement in the state affairs with Petliura.</ref> while Petliura left the SDPists, thus demonstrating that the Ukrainian government has changed its political agenda and is not the same that signed the treaty in [[Brest, Belarus|Brest-Litovsk]].  In light of that a new Prime-Minister was appointed as well, [[Serhiy Ostapenko]] who headed his non-socialist government on [[February 11]], 1919. When the talks have failed Ostapenko was replaced by [[Borys Martos]] on [[April 9]], 1919.

 ==History==
+In December 1918 [[Hetman of Ukraine|Hetman]] of the [[Ukrainian State]] [[Pavlo Skoropadskyi]] was deposed and the Directorate was established.<ref name=endSkoro/><ref name=Orest/>
 ===Post-Hetmanate recovery===
 With the defeat of the [[Central Powers]] in World War I, Skoropadsky could no longer rely on Germany and [[Austria-Hungary]]'s support. On November 13, 1918 Skoropadky's opponents set up a rival body known as the Directory, whose forces were headed by the newly reformed [[Sich Rifles]]. Most of Skoropadsky's troops joined with the Directory during a month long the Ukrainian Civil War. Skoropadsky then turned to some of the Russian officers who were fighting alongside [[Denikin]], forming them into a Special Corps, but these troops were not able to face the Directory troops.  On December 19, 1918, the Directory troops took [[Kiev]] and overthrew Skoropadsky's regime.

+With the defeat of the [[Central Powers]] in World War I, Skoropadsky could no longer rely on Germany and [[Austria-Hungary]]'s support. On November 13, 1918 Skoropadky's opponents set up a rival body known as the Directory, whose forces were headed by the newly reformed [[Sich Rifles]]. Most of Skoropadsky's troops joined with the Directory during a month long the Ukrainian Civil War. Skoropadsky then turned to some of the Russian officers who were fighting alongside [[Denikin]], forming them into a Special Corps, but these troops were not able to face the Directory troops.  On December 19, 1918, the Directory troops took [[Kiev]] and overthrew Skoropadsky's regime.
 
 The Directory re-established the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]] (UNR).  The new regime was torn between the pro-nationalistic, including the party of peasant-democrats, and the factions for the federal union with Russia. At the end the idea to reestablish the [[Central Rada]] was set aside as well as to recover all its legal acts yet the most important one were preserved. On December 26, 1918 the Directory released its declaration to eliminate the Hetman regime.
 
 By the end of 1918 the Directory began to be dominated by the Ukrainian military leader, [[Symon Petliura]].
 
-Faced by many enemies on all sides the UNR's army was organised to face each threat. To the North-east were the [[Bolsheviks]], to the south-east were the [[White movement|Russian Whites]], to the south-west [[Romania]]ns who had claims on territory in [[Bucovina]] and [[Halychyna]], and the [[France|French]] intervention force took [[Odessa]] in December 1918 to fill the power vacuum left by the withdrawing Austrians and Germans. Coming quickly to some understanding with the French and the Romanians, the UNR's army was able to employ more men on other fronts.
+Faced by many enemies on all sides the UNR's army was organised to face each threat. To the North-east were the [[Bolsheviks]], to the south-east were the [[White movement|Russian Whites]], to the south-west [[Romania]]ns who had claims on territory in [[Bucovina]] and [[Halychyna]], and the French intervention force took [[Odessa]] in December 1918 to fill the power vacuum left by the withdrawing Austrians and Germans. Coming quickly to some understanding with the French and the Romanians, the UNR's army was able to employ more men on other fronts.
 
 ===Change of powers 1919-1920===
-{{seealso|Ukrainian–Soviet War}}
-With major fighting breaking out in January 1919, the Ukrainians were pushed back and Kiev fell in February 1919. The government moved to [[Vinnytsia]] on [[February 5]], 1919. A political trick took place that the Directory tried to play with [[Volodymyr Vynnychenko]] resignation to demonstrate a change of powers in the Ukrainian government and maybe attain a possible acceptance with the Entante. [[Symon Petliura]] has left the party and replaced the Vynnychenko's position who was too well known. Petliura has assumed the position of the Directory's chairman on [[February 11]], 1919, a week after the government moved to [[Podolie|Podillia]]. The talks, alias, were proved to be without results. By May 1919, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land around [[Brody]]. Soviets then negotiated with the [[Poles]], who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamianets-Podilskyi]]. In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the [[Western Ukrainian Republic]]'s forces, who had been pushed out of [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]] by the Poles.  During that time (May 1919), General [[Anton Denikin|Denikin]] and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during the summer and autumn of that year. The ''White Guards'' forces pushed the Reds out of the Central and Eastern Ukraine, thus, given the Directory another chance to reclaim [[Kiev]]. But the constant ''Red Guards'' counter-attacks and a deadly typhus epidemic caused the Petliura forces to be pushed out of Ukraine completely into the well established territory of Poland. A political crisis took place inside the Directory members of which were heavily interfered in the affairs of the Council of People's Ministers. Because of that Shvets and Makarenko were sent on the state matters abroad. Later in May 1920 on the request of Petliura to return they did not reply and were dismissed.
+{{see also|Ukrainian–Soviet War}}
+With major fighting breaking out in January 1919, the Ukrainians were pushed back and Kiev fell in February 1919. The government moved to [[Vinnytsia]] on February 5, 1919. A political trick took place that the Directory tried to play with [[Volodymyr Vynnychenko]] resignation to demonstrate a change of powers in the Ukrainian government and maybe attain a possible acceptance with the Entante. [[Symon Petliura]] has left the party and replaced the Vynnychenko's position who was too well known. Petliura has assumed the position of the Directory's chairman on February 11, 1919, a week after the government moved to [[Podolie|Podillia]]. The talks, alias, were proved to be without results. By May 1919, the Directory's armies had been squeezed into a narrow strip of land around [[Brody]]. Soviets then negotiated with the [[Poles]], who were attacking the Ukrainians from behind, with this ceasefire, the Ukrainians were able to counter-attack and re-take [[Podilia]] and established a new capital in [[Kamianets-Podilskyi]]. In June, the UNR's forces were joined by the [[Western Ukrainian Republic]]'s forces, who had been pushed out of [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]] by the Poles.  During that time (May 1919), General [[Anton Denikin|Denikin]] and his white army launched an offensive against the Reds, during the summer and autumn of that year. The ''White Guards'' forces pushed the Reds out of the Central and Eastern Ukraine, thus, given the Directory another chance to reclaim [[Kiev]]. But the constant ''Red Guards'' counter-attacks and a deadly typhus epidemic caused the Petliura forces to be pushed out of Ukraine completely into the well established territory of Poland. A political crisis took place inside the Directory members of which were heavily interfered in the affairs of the Council of People's Ministers. Because of that Shvets and Makarenko were sent on the state matters abroad. Later in May 1920 on the request of Petliura to return they did not reply and were dismissed.
 
 In 1920, the Polish Army reorganized with the help from the two new Ukrainian divisions to prepare an offensive against the Denikin's forces. A [[Treaty of Warsaw (1920)|UNR-Polish Treaty]] in April 1920 provided for combined operations between the two armies under overall Polish command while recognizing the Polish sovereignty over the territory of the former [[West Ukrainian People's Republic]] with the border passing along the [[Zbruch river]]. In the [[Polish-Soviet War in 1920|Soviet-Polish war of 1920]], the Poles and Ukrainians advanced side by side, and the UNR was set up again when they re-took Kiev. But less than a month later the Soviet's summer counter-offensive left the Poles and Ukrainians retreating, an armistice was signed in late 1920. With this great disappointment, the UNR forces launched an attack on their own against the Reds from Polish territory, however that was quickly beaten. They were forced back into Galicia. In 1920 Poland concluded a border dispute by the [[Treaty of Riga]] with the Soviet Union, thus, canceling the [[Treaty of Warsaw (1920)]].
